text: Chapter 1
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It must have been a little after three o'clock in the afternoon that it
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: happened--the afternoon of June 3rd, 1916.  It seems incredible that
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all that I have passed through--all those weird and terrifying
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: experiences--should have been encompassed within so short a span as
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: three brief months.  Rather might I have experienced a cosmic cycle,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with all its changes and evolutions for that which I have seen with my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: own eyes in this brief interval of time--things that no other mortal
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eye had seen before, glimpses of a world past, a world dead, a world so
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: long dead that even in the lowest Cambrian stratum no trace of it
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: remains.  Fused with the melting inner crust, it has passed forever
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beyond the ken of man other than in that lost pocket of the earth
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: whither fate has borne me and where my doom is sealed. I am here and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: here must remain.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: After reading this far, my interest, which already had been stimulated
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by the finding of the manuscript, was approaching the boiling-point.  I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had come to Greenland for the summer, on the advice of my physician,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and was slowly being bored to extinction, as I had thoughtlessly
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: neglected to bring sufficient reading-matter. Being an indifferent
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fisherman, my enthusiasm for this form of sport soon waned; yet in the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: absence of other forms of recreation I was now risking my life in an
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: entirely inadequate boat off Cape Farewell at the southernmost
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: extremity of Greenland.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Greenland!  As a descriptive appellation, it is a sorry joke--but my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: story has nothing to do with Greenland, nothing to do with me; so I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shall get through with the one and the other as rapidly as possible.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The inadequate boat finally arrived at a precarious landing, the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: natives, waist-deep in the surf, assisting.  I was carried ashore, and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: while the evening meal was being prepared, I wandered to and fro along
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the rocky, shattered shore.  Bits of surf-harried beach clove the worn
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: granite, or whatever the rocks of Cape Farewell may be composed of, and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as I followed the ebbing tide down one of these soft stretches, I saw
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the thing.  Were one to bump into a Bengal tiger in the ravine behind
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Bimini Baths, one could be no more surprised than was I to see a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: perfectly good quart thermos bottle turning and twisting in the surf of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Cape Farewell at the southern extremity of Greenland. I rescued it, but
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was soaked above the knees doing it; and then I sat down in the sand
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and opened it, and in the long twilight read the manuscript, neatly
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: written and tightly folded, which was its contents.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: You have read the opening paragraph, and if you are an imaginative
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: idiot like myself, you will want to read the rest of it; so I shall
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: give it to you here, omitting quotation marks--which are difficult of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: remembrance.  In two minutes you will forget me.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My home is in Santa Monica.  I am, or was, junior member of my father's
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: firm.  We are ship-builders.  Of recent years we have specialized on
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: submarines, which we have built for Germany, England, France and the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: United States.  I know a sub as a mother knows her baby's face, and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have commanded a score of them on their trial runs.  Yet my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inclinations were all toward aviation. I graduated under Curtiss, and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: after a long siege with my father obtained his permission to try for
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Lafayette Escadrille.  As a stepping-stone I obtained an
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: appointment in the American ambulance service and was on my way to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: France when three shrill whistles altered, in as many seconds, my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: entire scheme of life.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was sitting on deck with some of the fellows who were going into the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: American ambulance service with me, my Airedale, Crown Prince Nobbler,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: asleep at my feet, when the first blast of the whistle shattered the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: peace and security of the ship.  Ever since entering the U-boat zone we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had been on the lookout for periscopes, and children that we were,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bemoaning the unkind fate that was to see us safely into France on the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: morrow without a glimpse of the dread marauders.  We were young; we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: craved thrills, and God knows we got them that day; yet by comparison
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with that through which I have since passed they were as tame as a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Punch-and-Judy show.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I shall never forget the ashy faces of the passengers as they stampeded
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for their life-belts, though there was no panic. Nobs rose with a low
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: growl.  I rose, also, and over the ship's side, I saw not two hundred
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: yards distant the periscope of a submarine, while racing toward the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: liner the wake of a torpedo was distinctly visible.  We were aboard an
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: American ship--which, of course, was not armed.  We were entirely
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: defenseless; yet without warning, we were being torpedoed.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I stood rigid, spellbound, watching the white wake of the torpedo. It
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: struck us on the starboard side almost amidships.  The vessel rocked as
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: though the sea beneath it had been uptorn by a mighty volcano. We were
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thrown to the decks, bruised and stunned, and then above the ship,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carrying with it fragments of steel and wood and dismembered human
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bodies, rose a column of water hundreds of feet into the air.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The silence which followed the detonation of the exploding torpedo was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: almost equally horrifying.  It lasted for perhaps two seconds, to be
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: followed by the screams and moans of the wounded, the cursing of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: men and the hoarse commands of the ship's officers.  They were
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: splendid--they and their crew.  Never before had I been so proud of my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nationality as I was that moment.  In all the chaos which followed the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: torpedoing of the liner no officer or member of the crew lost his head
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: or showed in the slightest any degree of panic or fear.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: While we were attempting to lower boats, the submarine emerged and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trained guns on us.  The officer in command ordered us to lower our
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: flag, but this the captain of the liner refused to do. The ship was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: listing frightfully to starboard, rendering the port boats useless,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: while half the starboard boats had been demolished by the explosion.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Even while the passengers were crowding the starboard rail and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: scrambling into the few boats left to us, the submarine commenced
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shelling the ship.  I saw one shell burst in a group of women and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: children, and then I turned my head and covered my eyes.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When I looked again to horror was added chagrin, for with the emerging
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the U-boat I had recognized her as a product of our own shipyard.  I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: knew her to a rivet.  I had superintended her construction.  I had sat
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in that very conning-tower and directed the efforts of the sweating
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crew below when first her prow clove the sunny summer waters of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Pacific; and now this creature of my brain and hand had turned
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Frankenstein, bent upon pursuing me to my death.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: A second shell exploded upon the deck.  One of the lifeboats,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: frightfully overcrowded, swung at a dangerous angle from its davits. A
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fragment of the shell shattered the bow tackle, and I saw the women and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: children and the men vomited into the sea beneath, while the boat
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dangled stern up for a moment from its single davit, and at last with
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: increasing momentum dived into the midst of the struggling victims
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: screaming upon the face of the waters.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Now I saw men spring to the rail and leap into the ocean.  The deck was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tilting to an impossible angle.  Nobs braced himself with all four feet
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to keep from slipping into the scuppers and looked up into my face with
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a questioning whine.  I stooped and stroked his head.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Come on, boy!" I cried, and running to the side of the ship, dived
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: headforemost over the rail.  When I came up, the first thing I saw was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Nobs swimming about in a bewildered sort of way a few yards from me.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At sight of me his ears went flat, and his lips parted in a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: characteristic grin.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The submarine was withdrawing toward the north, but all the time it was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shelling the open boats, three of them, loaded to the gunwales with
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: survivors.  Fortunately the small boats presented a rather poor target,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which, combined with the bad marksmanship of the Germans preserved
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their occupants from harm; and after a few minutes a blotch of smoke
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: appeared upon the eastern horizon and the U-boat submerged and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: disappeared.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: All the time the lifeboats had been pulling away from the danger of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sinking liner, and now, though I yelled at the top of my lungs, they
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: either did not hear my appeals for help or else did not dare return to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: succor me.  Nobs and I had gained some little distance from the ship
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when it rolled completely over and sank. We were caught in the suction
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: only enough to be drawn backward a few yards, neither of us being
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carried beneath the surface. I glanced hurriedly about for something to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which to cling. My eyes were directed toward the point at which the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: liner had disappeared when there came from the depths of the ocean the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: muffled reverberation of an explosion, and almost simultaneously a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: geyser of water in which were shattered lifeboats, human bodies, steam,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: coal, oil, and the flotsam of a liner's deck leaped high above the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surface of the sea--a watery column momentarily marking the grave of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: another ship in this greatest cemetery of the seas.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: When the turbulent waters had somewhat subsided and the sea had ceased
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to spew up wreckage, I ventured to swim back in search of something
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: substantial enough to support my weight and that of Nobs as well.  I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had gotten well over the area of the wreck when not a half-dozen yards
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ahead of me a lifeboat shot bow foremost out of the ocean almost its
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: entire length to flop down upon its keel with a mighty splash.  It must
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have been carried far below, held to its mother ship by a single rope
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which finally parted to the enormous strain put upon it.  In no other
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: way can I account for its having leaped so far out of the water--a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beneficent circumstance to which I doubtless owe my life, and that of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: another far dearer to me than my own.  I say beneficent circumstance
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: even in the face of the fact that a fate far more hideous confronts us
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: than that which we escaped that day; for because of that circumstance I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have met her whom otherwise I never should have known; I have met and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: loved her.  At least I have had that great happiness in life; nor can
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspak, with all her horrors, expunge that which has been.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: So for the thousandth time I thank the strange fate which sent that
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lifeboat hurtling upward from the green pit of destruction to which it
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had been dragged--sent it far up above the surface, emptying its water
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as it rose above the waves, and dropping it upon the surface of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sea, buoyant and safe.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It did not take me long to clamber over its side and drag Nobs in to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: comparative safety, and then I glanced around upon the scene of death
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and desolation which surrounded us.  The sea was littered with wreckage
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: among which floated the pitiful forms of women and children, buoyed up
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by their useless lifebelts. Some were torn and mangled; others lay
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rolling quietly to the motion of the sea, their countenances composed
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and peaceful; others were set in hideous lines of agony or horror.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Close to the boat's side floated the figure of a girl.  Her face was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: turned upward, held above the surface by her life-belt, and was framed
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in a floating mass of dark and waving hair.  She was very beautiful.  I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had never looked upon such perfect features, such a divine molding
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which was at the same time human--intensely human.  It was a face
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: filled with character and strength and femininity--the face of one who
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was created to love and to be loved.  The cheeks were flushed to the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hue of life and health and vitality, and yet she lay there upon the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bosom of the sea, dead.  I felt something rise in my throat as I looked
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: down upon that radiant vision, and I swore that I should live to avenge
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her murder.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And then I let my eyes drop once more to the face upon the water, and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: what I saw nearly tumbled me backward into the sea, for the eyes in the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dead face had opened; the lips had parted; and one hand was raised
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward me in a mute appeal for succor.  She lived! She was not dead! I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: leaned over the boat's side and drew her quickly in to the comparative
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: safety which God had given me.  I removed her life-belt and my soggy
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: coat and made a pillow for her head.  I chafed her hands and arms and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feet.  I worked over her for an hour, and at last I was rewarded by a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deep sigh, and again those great eyes opened and looked into mine.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At that I was all embarrassment.  I have never been a ladies' man; at
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Leland-Stanford I was the butt of the class because of my hopeless
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: imbecility in the presence of a pretty girl; but the men liked me,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nevertheless.  I was rubbing one of her hands when she opened her eyes,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and I dropped it as though it were a red-hot rivet. Those eyes took me
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in slowly from head to foot; then they wandered slowly around the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: horizon marked by the rising and falling gunwales of the lifeboat.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They looked at Nobs and softened, and then came back to me filled with
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: questioning.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I--I--" I stammered, moving away and stumbling over the next thwart.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The vision smiled wanly.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Aye-aye, sir!" she replied faintly, and again her lips drooped, and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her long lashes swept the firm, fair texture of her skin.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I hope that you are feeling better," I finally managed to say.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Do you know," she said after a moment of silence, "I have been awake
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for a long time!  But I did not dare open my eyes. I thought I must be
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dead, and I was afraid to look, for fear that I should see nothing but
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: blackness about me.  I am afraid to die!  Tell me what happened after
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the ship went down. I remember all that happened before--oh, but I wish
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I might forget it!"  A sob broke her voice.  "The beasts!" she
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: went on after a moment.  "And to think that I was to have married one
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of them--a lieutenant in the German navy."

text: Presently she resumed as though she had not ceased speaking. "I went
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: down and down and down.  I thought I should never cease to sink.  I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: felt no particular distress until I suddenly started upward at
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ever-increasing velocity; then my lungs seemed about to burst, and I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: must have lost consciousness, for I remember nothing more until I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: opened my eyes after listening to a torrent of invective against
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Germany and Germans.  Tell me, please, all that happened after the ship
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sank."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I told her, then, as well as I could, all that I had seen--the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: submarine shelling the open boats and all the rest of it. She thought
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it marvelous that we should have been spared in so providential a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: manner, and I had a pretty speech upon my tongue's end, but lacked the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nerve to deliver it.  Nobs had come over and nosed his muzzle into her
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lap, and she stroked his ugly face, and at last she leaned over and put
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her cheek against his forehead. I have always admired Nobs; but this
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was the first time that it had ever occurred to me that I might wish to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be Nobs.  I wondered how he would take it, for he is as unused to women
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as I.  But he took to it as a duck takes to water.  What I lack of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: being a ladies' man, Nobs certainly makes up for as a ladies' dog. The
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: old scalawag just closed his eyes and put on one of the softest
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "sugar-wouldn't-melt-in-my-mouth" expressions you ever saw and stood
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there taking it and asking for more.  It made me jealous.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You seem fond of dogs," I said.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I am fond of this dog," she replied.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Whether she meant anything personal in that reply I did not know; but I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: took it as personal and it made me feel mighty good.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As we drifted about upon that vast expanse of loneliness it is not
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strange that we should quickly become well acquainted. Constantly we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: scanned the horizon for signs of smoke, venturing guesses as to our
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chances of rescue; but darkness settled, and the black night enveloped
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us without ever the sight of a speck upon the waters.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We were thirsty, hungry, uncomfortable, and cold.  Our wet garments had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dried but little and I knew that the girl must be in grave danger from
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the exposure to a night of cold and wet upon the water in an open boat,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: without sufficient clothing and no food.  I had managed to bail all the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: water out of the boat with cupped hands, ending by mopping the balance
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: up with my handkerchief--a slow and back-breaking procedure; thus I had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: made a comparatively dry place for the girl to lie down low in the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bottom of the boat, where the sides would protect her from the night
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wind, and when at last she did so, almost overcome as she was by
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weakness and fatigue, I threw my wet coat over her further to thwart
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the chill.  But it was of no avail; as I sat watching her, the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: moonlight marking out the graceful curves of her slender young body, I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: saw her shiver.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Isn't there something I can do?" I asked.  "You can't lie there
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chilled through all night.  Can't you suggest something?"
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She shook her head.  "We must grin and bear it," she replied after a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: moment.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Nobbler came and lay down on the thwart beside me, his back against my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: leg, and I sat staring in dumb misery at the girl, knowing in my heart
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of hearts that she might die before morning came, for what with the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shock and exposure, she had already gone through enough to kill almost
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: any woman. And as I gazed down at her, so small and delicate and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: helpless, there was born slowly within my breast a new emotion.  It had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: never been there before; now it will never cease to be there.  It made
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me almost frantic in my desire to find some way to keep warm the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cooling lifeblood in her veins.  I was cold myself, though I had almost
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forgotten it until Nobbler moved and I felt a new sensation of cold
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: along my leg against which he had lain, and suddenly realized that in
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that one spot I had been warm.  Like a great light came the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: understanding of a means to warm the girl.  Immediately I knelt beside
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her to put my scheme into practice when suddenly I was overwhelmed with
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: embarrassment.  Would she permit it, even if I could muster the courage
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to suggest it?  Then I saw her frame convulse, shudderingly, her
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: muscles reacting to her rapidly lowering temperature, and casting
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prudery to the winds, I threw myself down beside her and took her in my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arms, pressing her body close to mine.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She drew away suddenly, voicing a little cry of fright, and tried to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: push me from her.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Forgive me," I managed to stammer.  "It is the only way. You will die
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of exposure if you are not warmed, and Nobs and I are the only means we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: can command for furnishing warmth." And I held her tightly while I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: called Nobs and bade him lie down at her back.  The girl didn't
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: struggle any more when she learned my purpose; but she gave two or
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: three little gasps, and then began to cry softly, burying her face on
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my arm, and thus she fell asleep.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Chapter 2
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Toward morning,  I must have dozed, though it seemed to me at the time
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that I had lain awake for days, instead of hours.  When I finally
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: opened my eyes, it was daylight, and the girl's hair was in my face,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and she was breathing normally.  I thanked God for that.  She had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: turned her head during the night so that as I opened my eyes I saw her
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: face not an inch from mine, my lips almost touching hers.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was Nobs who finally awoke her.  He got up, stretched, turned around
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a few times and lay down again, and the girl opened her eyes and looked
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into mine.  Hers went very wide at first, and then slowly comprehension
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: came to her, and she smiled.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You have been very good to me," she said, as I helped her to rise,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: though if the truth were known I was more in need of assistance than
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she; the circulation all along my left side seeming to be paralyzed
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: entirely.  "You have been very good to me." And that was the only
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mention she ever made of it; yet I know that she was thankful and that
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: only reserve prevented her from referring to what, to say the least,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was an embarrassing situation, however unavoidable.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Shortly after daylight we saw smoke apparently coming straight toward
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us, and after a time we made out the squat lines of a tug--one of those
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fearless exponents of England's supremacy of the sea that tows sailing
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ships into French and English ports. I stood up on a thwart and waved
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my soggy coat above my head. Nobs stood upon another and barked.  The
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: girl sat at my feet straining her eyes toward the deck of the oncoming
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: boat. "They see us," she said at last.  "There is a man answering your
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: signal." She was right.  A lump came into my throat--for her sake
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rather than for mine.  She was saved, and none too soon. She could not
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have lived through another night upon the Channel; she might not have
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lived through the coming day.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The tug came close beside us, and a man on deck threw us a rope.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Willing hands dragged us to the deck, Nobs scrambling nimbly aboard
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: without assistance.  The rough men were gentle as mothers with the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: girl.  Plying us both with questions they hustled her to the captain's
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cabin and me to the boiler-room.  They told the girl to take off her
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wet clothes and throw them outside the door that they might be dried,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and then to slip into the captain's bunk and get warm.  They didn't
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have to tell me to strip after I once got into the warmth of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: boiler-room.  In a jiffy, my clothes hung about where they might dry
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: most quickly, and I myself was absorbing, through every pore, the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: welcome heat of the stifling compartment.  They brought us hot soup and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: coffee, and then those who were not on duty sat around and helped me
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: damn the Kaiser and his brood.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As soon as our clothes were dry, they bade us don them, as the chances
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were always more than fair in those waters that we should run into
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trouble with the enemy, as I was only too well aware. What with the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warmth and the feeling of safety for the girl, and the knowledge that a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: little rest and food would quickly overcome the effects of her
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: experiences of the past dismal hours, I was feeling more content than I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had experienced since those three whistle-blasts had shattered the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: peace of my world the previous afternoon.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But peace upon the Channel has been but a transitory thing since
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: August, 1914.  It proved itself such that morning, for I had scarce
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gotten into my dry clothes and taken the girl's apparel to the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: captain's cabin when an order was shouted down into the engine-room for
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: full speed ahead, and an instant later I heard the dull boom of a gun.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In a moment I was up on deck to see an enemy submarine about two
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hundred yards off our port bow.  She had signaled us to stop, and our
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: skipper had ignored the order; but now she had her gun trained on us,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and the second shot grazed the cabin, warning the belligerent
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tug-captain that it was time to obey.  Once again an order went down to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the engine-room, and the tug reduced speed.  The U-boat ceased firing
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and ordered the tug to come about and approach.  Our momentum had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carried us a little beyond the enemy craft, but we were turning now on
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the arc of a circle that would bring us alongside her.  As I stood
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: watching the maneuver and wondering what was to become of us, I felt
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: something touch my elbow and turned to see the girl standing at my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: side.  She looked up into my face with a rueful expression. "They seem
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bent on our destruction," she said, "and it looks like the same boat
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that sunk us yesterday."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It is," I replied.  "I know her well.  I helped design her and took
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her out on her first run."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The girl drew back from me with a little exclamation of surprise and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: disappointment.  "I thought you were an American," she said. "I had no
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: idea you were a--a--"
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Nor am I," I replied.  "Americans have been building submarines for
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all nations for many years.  I wish, though, that we had gone bankrupt,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my father and I, before ever we turned out that Frankenstein of a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thing."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We were approaching the U-boat at half speed now, and I could almost
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: distinguish the features of the men upon her deck. A sailor stepped to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my side and slipped something hard and cold into my hand.  I did not
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have to look at it to know that it was a heavy pistol.  "Tyke 'er an'
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: use 'er," was all he said.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Our bow was pointed straight toward the U-boat now as I heard word
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: passed to the engine for full speed ahead.  I instantly grasped the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brazen effrontery of the plucky English skipper--he was going to ram
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: five hundreds tons of U-boat in the face of her trained gun.  I could
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: scarce repress a cheer.  At first the boches didn't seem to grasp his
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: intention.  Evidently they thought they were witnessing an exhibition
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of poor seamanship, and they yelled their warnings to the tug to reduce
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: speed and throw the helm hard to port.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We were within fifty feet of them when they awakened to the intentional
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: menace of our maneuver.  Their gun crew was off its guard; but they
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sprang to their piece now and sent a futile shell above our heads.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Nobs leaped about and barked furiously.  "Let 'em have it!" commanded
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the tug-captain, and instantly revolvers and rifles poured bullets upon
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the deck of the submersible.  Two of the gun-crew went down; the other
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trained their piece at the water-line of the oncoming tug.  The balance
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of those on deck replied to our small-arms fire, directing their
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: efforts toward the man at our wheel.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I hastily pushed the girl down the companionway leading to the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: engine-room, and then I raised my pistol and fired my first shot at a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: boche.  What happened in the next few seconds happened so quickly that
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: details are rather blurred in my memory.  I saw the helmsman lunge
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forward upon the wheel, pulling the helm around so that the tug sheered
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: off quickly from her course, and I recall realizing that all our
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: efforts were to be in vain, because of all the men aboard, Fate had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: decreed that this one should fall first to an enemy bullet.  I saw the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: depleted gun-crew on the submarine fire their piece and I felt the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shock of impact and heard the loud explosion as the shell struck and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: exploded in our bows.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I saw and realized these things even as I was leaping into the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pilot-house and grasping the wheel, standing astride the dead body of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the helmsman.  With all my strength I threw the helm to starboard; but
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it was too late to effect the purpose of our skipper.  The best I did
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was to scrape alongside the sub. I heard someone shriek an order into
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the engine-room; the boat shuddered and trembled to the sudden
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reversing of the engines, and our speed quickly lessened.  Then I saw
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: what that madman of a skipper planned since his first scheme had gone
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wrong.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: With a loud-yelled command, he leaped to the slippery deck of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: submersible, and at his heels came his hardy crew.  I sprang from the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pilot-house and followed, not to be left out in the cold when it came
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to strafing the boches.  From the engine room companionway came the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: engineer and stockers, and together we leaped after the balance of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crew and into the hand-to-hand fight that was covering the wet deck
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with red blood.  Beside me came Nobs, silent now, and grim.  Germans
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were emerging from the open hatch to take part in the battle on deck.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At first the pistols cracked amidst the cursing of the men and the loud
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: commands of the commander and his junior; but presently we were too
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: indiscriminately mixed to make it safe to use our firearms, and the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: battle resolved itself into a hand-to-hand struggle for possession of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the deck.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The sole aim of each of us was to hurl one of the opposing force into
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the sea.  I shall never forget the hideous expression upon the face of

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice
