author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inhabited the world for us, I ordered that the other engine be started
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: so that we could move out of the path of the oncoming steamer.  The
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: moment the engine started to turn, however, there was a grinding sound
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of tortured steel, and when it had been stopped, we found that some one
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had placed a cold-chisel in one of the gears.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was another two days before we were ready to limp along, half
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: repaired.  The night before the repairs were completed, the sentry came
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to my room and awoke me.  He was rather an intelligent fellow of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: English middle class, in whom I had much confidence.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Well, Wilson," I asked.  "What's the matter now?"
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He raised his finger to his lips and came closer to me.  "I think I've
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: found out who's doin' the mischief," he whispered, and nodded his head
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward the girl's room.  "I seen her sneakin' from the crew's room just
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: now," he went on.  "She'd been in gassin' wit' the boche commander.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Benson seen her in there las' night, too, but he never said nothin'
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: till I goes on watch tonight. Benson's sorter slow in the head, an' he
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: never puts two an' two together till some one else has made four out of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: If the man had come in and struck me suddenly in the face, I could have
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been no more surprised.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Say nothing of this to anyone," I ordered.  "Keep your eyes and ears
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: open and report every suspicious thing you see or hear."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The man saluted and left me; but for an hour or more I tossed,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: restless, upon my hard bunk in an agony of jealousy and fear. Finally I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fell into a troubled sleep.  It was daylight when I awoke. We were
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: steaming along slowly upon the surface, my orders having been to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: proceed at half speed until we could take an observation and determine
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: our position.  The sky had been overcast all the previous day and all
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: night; but as I stepped into the centrale that morning I was delighted
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to see that the sun was again shining. The spirits of the men seemed
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: improved; everything seemed propitious. I forgot at once the cruel
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: misgivings of the past night as I set to work to take my observations.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: What a blow awaited me!  The sextant and chronometer had both been
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: broken beyond repair,  and they had been broken just this very night.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They had been broken upon the night that Lys had been seen talking with
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: von Schoenvorts.  I think that it was this last thought which hurt me
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the worst.  I could look the other disaster in the face with
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: equanimity; but the bald fact that Lys might be a traitor appalled me.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I called Bradley and Olson on deck and told them what had happened, but
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for the life of me I couldn't bring myself to repeat what Wilson had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reported to me the previous night. In fact, as I had given the matter
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thought, it seemed incredible that the girl could have passed through
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my room, in which Bradley and I slept, and then carried on a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conversation in the crew's room, in which Von Schoenvorts was kept,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: without having been seen by more than a single man.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Bradley shook his head.  "I can't make it out," he said.  "One of those
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: boches must be pretty clever to come it over us all like this; but they
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: haven't harmed us as much as they think; there are still the extra
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instruments."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was my turn now to shake a doleful head.  "There are no extra
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instruments," I told them.  "They too have disappeared as did the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wireless apparatus."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Both men looked at me in amazement.  "We still have the compass and the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sun," said Olson.  "They may be after getting the compass some night;
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but they's too many of us around in the daytime fer 'em to get the sun."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was then that one of the men stuck his head up through the hatchway
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and seeing me, asked permission to come on deck and get a breath of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fresh air.  I recognized him as Benson, the man who, Wilson had said,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reported having seen Lys with von Schoenvorts two nights before.  I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: motioned him on deck and then called him to one side, asking if he had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seen anything out of the way or unusual during his trick on watch the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: night before.  The fellow scratched his head a moment and said, "No,"
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and then as though it was an afterthought, he told me that he had seen
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the girl in the crew's room about midnight talking with the German
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: commander, but as there hadn't seemed to him to be any harm in that, he
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hadn't said anything about it.  Telling him never to fail to report to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me anything in the slightest out of the ordinary routine of the ship, I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dismissed him.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Several of the other men now asked permission to come on deck, and soon
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all but those actually engaged in some necessary duty were standing
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: around smoking and talking, all in the best of spirits. I took
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: advantage of the absence of the men upon the deck to go below for my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: breakfast, which the cook was already preparing upon the electric
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stove.  Lys, followed by Nobs, appeared as I entered the centrale.  She
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: met me with a pleasant "Good morning!" which I am afraid I replied to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in a tone that was rather constrained and surly.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Will you breakfast with me?" I suddenly asked the girl, determined to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: commence a probe of my own along the lines which duty demanded.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She nodded a sweet acceptance of my invitation, and together we sat
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: down at the little table of the officers' mess.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You slept well last night?" I asked.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "All night," she replied.  "I am a splendid sleeper."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Her manner was so straightforward and honest that I could not bring
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: myself to believe in her duplicity; yet--Thinking to surprise her into
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a betrayal of her guilt, I blurted out:  "The chronometer and sextant
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were both destroyed last night; there is a traitor among us."  But she
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: never turned a hair by way of evidencing guilty knowledge of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: catastrophe.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Who could it have been?" she cried.  "The Germans would be crazy to do
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it, for their lives are as much at stake as ours."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Men are often glad to die for an ideal--an ideal of patriotism,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: perhaps," I replied; "and a willingness to martyr themselves includes a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: willingness to sacrifice others, even those who love them.  Women are
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: much the same, except that they will go even further than most
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: men--they will sacrifice everything, even honor, for love."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I watched her face carefully as I spoke, and I thought that I detected
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a very faint flush mounting her cheek.  Seeing an opening and an
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: advantage, I sought to follow it up.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Take von Schoenvorts, for instance," I continued: "he would doubtless
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be glad to die and take us all with him, could he prevent in no other
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: way the falling of his vessel into enemy hands. He would sacrifice
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: anyone, even you; and if you still love him, you might be his ready
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tool.  Do you understand me?"
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She looked at me in wide-eyed consternation for a moment, and then she
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: went very white and rose from her seat.  "I do," she replied, and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: turning her back upon me, she walked quickly toward her room.  I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: started to follow, for even believing what I did, I was sorry that I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had hurt her.  I reached the door to the crew's room just behind her
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and in time to see von Schoenvorts lean forward and whisper something
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to her as she passed; but she must have guessed that she might be
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: watched, for she passed on.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: That afternoon it clouded over; the wind mounted to a gale, and the sea
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rose until the craft was wallowing and rolling frightfully. Nearly
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: everyone aboard was sick; the air became foul and oppressive. For
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: twenty-four hours I did not leave my post in the conning tower, as both
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Olson and Bradley were sick.  Finally I found that I must get a little
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rest, and so I looked about for some one to relieve me. Benson
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: volunteered.  He had not been sick, and assured me that he was a former
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: R.N. man and had been detailed for submarine duty for over two years.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I was glad that it was he, for I had considerable confidence in his
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: loyalty, and so it was with a feeling of security that I went below and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lay down.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I slept twelve hours straight, and when I awoke and discovered what I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had done, I lost no time in getting to the conning tower. There sat
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Benson as wide awake as could be, and the compass showed that we were
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heading straight into the west.  The storm was still raging; nor did it
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: abate its fury until the fourth day. We were all pretty well done up
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and looked forward to the time when we could go on deck and fill our
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lungs with fresh air. During the whole four days I had not seen the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: girl, as she evidently kept closely to her room; and during this time
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: no untoward incident had occurred aboard the boat--a fact which seemed
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to strengthen the web of circumstantial evidence about her.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For six more days after the storm lessened we still had fairly rough
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weather; nor did the sun once show himself during all that time.  For
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the season--it was now the middle of June--the storm was unusual; but
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: being from southern California, I was accustomed to unusual weather.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In fact, I have discovered that the world over, unusual weather
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prevails at all times of the year.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We kept steadily to our westward course, and as the U-33 was one of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fastest submersibles we had ever turned out, I knew that we must be
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pretty close to the North American coast.  What puzzled me most was the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fact that for six days we had not sighted a single ship.  It seemed
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: remarkable that we could cross the Atlantic almost to the coast of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: American continent without glimpsing smoke or sail, and at last I came
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to the conclusion that we were way off our course, but whether to the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: north or to the south of it I could not determine.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: On the seventh day the sea lay comparatively calm at early dawn. There
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was a slight haze upon the ocean which had cut off our view of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stars; but conditions all pointed toward a clear morrow, and I was on
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deck anxiously awaiting the rising of the sun.  My eyes were glued upon
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the impenetrable mist astern, for there in the east I should see the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: first glow of the rising sun that would assure me we were still upon
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the right course.  Gradually the heavens lightened; but astern I could
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: see no intenser glow that would indicate the rising sun behind the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mist.  Bradley was standing at my side.  Presently he touched my arm.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Look, captain," he said, and pointed south.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I looked and gasped, for there directly to port I saw outlined through
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the haze the red top of the rising sun.  Hurrying to the tower, I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: looked at the compass.  It showed that we were holding steadily upon
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: our westward course.  Either the sun was rising in the south, or the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: compass had been tampered with.  The conclusion was obvious.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I went back to Bradley and told him what I had discovered. "And," I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: concluded, "we can't make another five hundred knots without oil; our
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: provisions are running low and so is our water. God only knows how far
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: south we have run."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "There is nothing to do," he replied, "other than to alter our course
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: once more toward the west; we must raise land soon or we shall all be
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lost."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I told him to do so; and then I set to work improvising a crude sextant
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with which we finally took our bearings in a rough and most
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unsatisfactory manner; for when the work was done, we did not know how
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: far from the truth the result might be.  It showed us to be about 20<U+00BA>
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: north and 30<U+00BA> west--nearly twenty-five hundred miles off our course.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In short, if our reading was anywhere near correct, we must have been
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: traveling due south for six days.  Bradley now relieved Benson, for we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had arranged our shifts so that the latter and Olson now divided the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nights, while Bradley and I alternated with one another during the days.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I questioned both Olson and Benson closely in the matter of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: compass; but each stoutly maintained that no one had tampered with it
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: during his tour of duty.  Benson gave me a knowing smile, as much as to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: say:  "Well, you and I know who did this."  Yet I could not believe
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that it was the girl.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We kept to our westerly course for several hours when the lookout's cry
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: announced a sail.  I ordered the U-33's course altered, and we bore
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: down upon the stranger, for I had come to a decision which was the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: result of necessity.  We could not lie there in the middle of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Atlantic and starve to death if there was any way out of it.  The
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sailing ship saw us while we were still a long way off, as was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: evidenced by her efforts to escape. There was scarcely any wind,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: however, and her case was hopeless; so when we drew near and signaled
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her to stop, she came into the wind and lay there with her sails
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: flapping idly.  We moved in quite close to her.  She was the Balmen of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Halmstad, Sweden, with a general cargo from Brazil for Spain.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I explained our circumstances to her skipper and asked for food, water
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and oil; but when he found that we were not German, he became very
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: angry and abusive and started to draw away from us; but I was in no
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mood for any such business.  Turning toward Bradley, who was in the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conning-tower, I snapped out: "Gun-service on deck!  To the diving
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stations!"  We had no opportunity for drill; but every man had been
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: posted as to his duties, and the German members of the crew understood
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that it was obedience or death for them, as each was accompanied by a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: man with a pistol.  Most of them, though, were only too glad to obey me.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Bradley passed the order down into the ship and a moment later the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gun-crew clambered up the narrow ladder and at my direction trained
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their piece upon the slow-moving Swede.  "Fire a shot across her bow,"
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I instructed the gun-captain.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Accept it from me, it didn't take that Swede long to see the error of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his way and get the red and white pennant signifying "I understand" to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the masthead.  Once again the sails flapped idly, and then I ordered
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him to lower a boat and come after me. With Olson and a couple of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot

text: Englishmen I boarded the ship, and from her cargo selected what we

text: needed--oil, provisions and water.  I gave the master of the Balmen a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

text: Balmen be reimbursed; but whether or not they were, I do not know.[1]
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: With water, food, and oil aboard, we felt that we had obtained a new
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lease of life.  Now, too, we knew definitely where we were, and I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: determined to make for Georgetown, British Guiana--but I was destined
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Six of us of the loyal crew had come on deck either to serve the gun or
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: board the Swede during our set-to with her; and now, one by one, we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: descended the ladder into the centrale.  I was the last to come, and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when I reached the bottom, I found myself looking into the muzzle of a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: guard over them.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I couldn't imagine how it had happened; but it had.  Later I learned
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that they had first overpowered Benson, who was asleep in his bunk, and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: taken his pistol from him, and then had found it an easy matter to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had been comparatively simple to stand at the foot of the ladder and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arrest each individual as he descended.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The first thing von Schoenvorts did was to send for me and announce
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that as a pirate I was to be shot early the next morning. Then he
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: explained that the U-33 would cruise in these waters for a time,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sinking neutral and enemy shipping indiscriminately, and looking for
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one of the German raiders that was supposed to be in these parts.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He didn't shoot me the next morning as he had promised, and it has
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: never been clear to me why he postponed the execution of my sentence.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Instead he kept me ironed just as he had been; then he kicked Bradley
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: out of my room and took it all to himself.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We cruised for a long time, sinking many vessels, all but one by
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gunfire, but we did not come across a German raider.  I was surprised
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to note that von Schoenvorts often permitted Benson to take command;
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but I reconciled this by the fact that Benson appeared to know more of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Once or twice Lys passed me; but for the most part she kept to her
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: room.  The first time she hesitated as though she wished to speak to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me; but I did not raise my head, and finally she passed on. Then one
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Pacific coast of North America and prey upon all sorts and conditions
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of merchantmen.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I'll put the fear of God and the Kaiser into them," he said.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: turned out to be quite the most exciting adventure I had ever
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: encountered.  It fell about this way.  About eight bells of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was at her side. "How can I thank you?" I started; but she shut me up

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Glancing up, I saw that the tower was empty, and I lost no time in
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

text: That evening the girl asked permission to go on deck.  She said that
title: The Land That Time Forgot

text: Lys stood with a heavy blanket wrapped around her slender figure, and

text: For several days things went along in about the same course. I took our
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: always most unsatisfactory.  They always showed a considerable westing

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when I knew that we had been sailing due north. I blamed my crude
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instrument, and kept on.  Then one afternoon the girl came to me.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Pardon me," she said, "but were I you, I should watch this man
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thinking I could see the influence of von Schoenvorts raising a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: until half an hour after Benson had gone on duty, and then I went on
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deck, passing through the conning-tower where Benson sat, and looking
title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one point west of north, which was, for our assumed position, about

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quickly, but not a long, heavy sea.  There was only one other

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot

text: of the conning-tower windows were shut, and then I leaned with my back

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: should do after I was washed away.  Should I swim until exhaustion
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: claimed me, or should I give up and end the agony at the first plunge?
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: From below came two muffled reports.  They sounded not unlike shots.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Was Benson meeting with resistance?  Personally it could mean little to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me, for even though my men might overcome the enemy, none would know of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my predicament until long after it was too late to succor me. The top
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the conning-tower was now awash.  I clung to the wireless mast,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crests of the higher waves; now the little triangular deck below became
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: visible!  What had occurred within?  Did Benson believe me already
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gone, and was he emerging because of that belief, or had he and his
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: started to empty them."

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and mumble my appreciation.  She made no reply--only turned and walked
title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a sob that came floating back to me through the narrow aisle of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Benson died that night.  He remained defiant almost to the last; but
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: just before he went out, he motioned to me, and I leaned over to catch
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the faintly whispered words.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I did it alone," he said.  "I did it because I hate you--I hate all
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: your kind.  I was kicked out of your shipyard at Santa Monica. I was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: locked out of California.  I am an I. W. W. I became a German
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: agent--not because I love them, for I hate them too--but because I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wanted to injure Americans, whom I hated more.  I threw the wireless
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: apparatus overboard.  I destroyed the chronometer and the sextant.  I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: That was all; Benson was dead.  We threw his body overboard.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The wind of that night brought on some pretty rough weather with a lot
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of black clouds which persisted for several days.  We didn't know what
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could no longer trust the compass, not knowing what Benson had done to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: until the sun came out again.  I'll never forget that day or its
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: surprises.  We reckoned, or rather guessed, that we were somewhere off
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: east, suddenly veered around into the south, and presently we felt a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sudden chill.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Peru?"
title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "What do you make of it?" I asked him.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: believe--in which he described a new continent in the south seas, a
title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "If you are right, it might account for much of the deviation of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We'll land upon Caprona.  Along that long front there must be a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rested.  Straight from the ocean's depths rose towering cliffs, shot
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon a large island five or six miles in length; and at fifty miles
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there was a still larger river than the last coming in from the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: northwest, the course of the main stream having now changed to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: northeast by southwest.  The water was quite free from reptiles, and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the vegetation upon the banks of the river had altered to more open and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: parklike forest, with eucalyptus and acacia mingled with a scattering
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of tree ferns, as though two distinct periods of geologic time had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: overlapped and merged. The grass, too, was less flowering, though there
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were still gorgeous patches mottling the greensward; and lastly, the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fauna was less multitudinous.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Six or seven miles farther, and the river widened considerably; before
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us opened an expanse of water to the farther horizon, and then we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sailed out upon an inland sea so large that only a shore-line upon our
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: side was visible to us.  The waters all about us were alive with life.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There were still a few reptiles; but there were fish by the thousands,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by the millions.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The water of the inland sea was very warm, almost hot, and the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: atmosphere was hot and heavy above it.  It seemed strange that beyond
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the buttressed walls of Caprona icebergs floated and the south wind was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: biting, for only a gentle breeze moved across the face of these living
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: waters, and that was damp and warm. Gradually, we commenced to divest
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ourselves of our clothing, retaining only sufficient for modesty; but
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the sun was not hot. It was more the heat of a steam-room than of an
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: oven.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We coasted up the shore of the lake in a north-westerly direction,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sounding all the time.  We found the lake deep and the bottom rocky and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: steeply shelving toward the center, and once when I moved straight out
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from shore to take other soundings we could find no bottom whatsoever.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: In open spaces along the shore we caught occasional glimpses of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: distant cliffs, and here they appeared only a trifle less precipitous
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: than those which bound Caprona on the seaward side.  My theory is that
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in a far distant era Caprona was a mighty mountain--perhaps the world's
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mightiest mountain--and that in some titanic eruption volcanic action
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: blew off the entire crest, blew thousands of feet of the mountain upward
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and outward and onto the surrounding continent, leaving a great crater;
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and then, possibly, the continent sank as ancient continents have been
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: known to do, leaving only the summit of Caprona above the sea. The
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: encircling walls, the central lake, the hot springs which feed the lake,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all point to such a conclusion, and the fauna and the flora bear
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: indisputable evidence that Caprona was once part of some great land-mass.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As we cruised up along the coast, the landscape continued a more or
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: less open forest, with here and there a small plain where we saw
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: animals grazing.  With my glass I could make out a species of large red
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deer, some antelope and what appeared to be a species of horse; and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: once I saw the shaggy form of what might have been a monstrous bison.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Here was game a plenty!  There seemed little danger of starving upon
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caprona.  The game, however, seemed wary; for the instant the animals
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: discovered us, they threw up their heads and tails and went cavorting
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: off, those farther inland following the example of the others until all
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were lost in the mazes of the distant forest.  Only the great, shaggy
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ox stood his ground.  With lowered head he watched us until we had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: passed, and then continued feeding.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: About twenty miles up the coast from the mouth of the river we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: encountered low cliffs of sandstone, broken and tortured evidence of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the great upheaval which had torn Caprona asunder in the past,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: intermingling upon a common level the rock formations of widely
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: separated eras, fusing some and leaving others untouched.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We ran along beside them for a matter of ten miles, arriving off a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: broad cleft which led into what appeared to be another lake. As we were
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in search of pure water, we did not wish to overlook any portion of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: coast, and so after sounding and finding that we had ample depth, I ran
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the U-33 between head-lands into as pretty a landlocked harbor as
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sailormen could care to see, with good water right up to within a few
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: yards of the shore.  As we cruised slowly along, two of the boches
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: again saw what they believed to be a man, or manlike creature, watching
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us from a fringe of trees a hundred yards inland, and shortly after we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: discovered the mouth of a small stream emptying into the bay. It was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the first stream we had found since leaving the river, and I at once
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: made preparations to test its water.  To land, it would be necessary to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: run the U-33 close in to the shore, at least as close as we could, for
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: even these waters were infested, though, not so thickly, by savage
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reptiles.  I ordered sufficient water let into the diving-tanks to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lower us about a foot, and then I ran the bow slowly toward the shore,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: confident that should we run aground, we still had sufficient lifting
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: force to free us when the water should be pumped out of the tanks; but
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the bow nosed its way gently into the reeds and touched the shore with
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the keel still clear.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My men were all armed now with both rifles and pistols, each having
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: plenty of ammunition.  I ordered one of the Germans ashore with a line,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and sent two of my own men to guard him, for from what little we had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seen of Caprona, or Caspak as we learned later to call the interior, we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: realized that any instant some new and terrible danger might confront
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us.  The line was made fast to a small tree, and at the same time I had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the stern anchor dropped.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As soon as the boche and his guard were aboard again, I called all
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hands on deck, including von Schoenvorts, and there I explained to them
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that the time had come for us to enter into some sort of an agreement
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: among ourselves that would relieve us of the annoyance and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: embarrassment of being divided into two antagonistic parts--prisoners
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and captors.  I told them that it was obvious our very existence
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: depended upon our unity of action, that we were to all intent and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: purpose entering a new world as far from the seat and causes of our own
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: world-war as if millions of miles of space and eons of time separated
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us from our past lives and habitations.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "There is no reason why we should carry our racial and political
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hatreds into Caprona," I insisted.  "The Germans among us might kill
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: all the English, or the English might kill the last German, without
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: affecting in the slightest degree either the outcome of even the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: smallest skirmish upon the western front or the opinion of a single
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: individual in any belligerent or neutral country. I therefore put the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: issue squarely to you all; shall we bury our animosities and work
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: together with and for one another while we remain upon Caprona, or must
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we continue thus divided and but half armed, possibly until death has
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: claimed the last of us?  And let me tell you, if you have not already
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: realized it, the chances are a thousand to one that not one of us ever
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: will see the outside world again.  We are safe now in the matter of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: food and water; we could provision the U-33 for a long cruise; but we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: are practically out of fuel, and without fuel we cannot hope to reach
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the ocean, as only a submarine can pass through the barrier cliffs.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: What is your answer?" I turned toward von Schoenvorts.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He eyed me in that disagreeable way of his and demanded to know, in
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: case they accepted my suggestion, what their status would be in event
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of our finding a way to escape with the U-33.  I replied that I felt
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that if we had all worked loyally together we should leave Caprona upon
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a common footing, and to that end I suggested that should the remote
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: possibility of our escape in the submarine develop into reality, we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: should then immediately make for the nearest neutral port and give
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ourselves into the hands of the authorities, when we should all
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: probably be interned for the duration of the war.  To my surprise he
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: agreed that this was fair and told me that they would accept my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conditions and that I could depend upon their loyalty to the common
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cause.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I thanked him and then addressed each one of his men individually, and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: each gave me his word that he would abide by all that I had outlined.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was further understood that we were to act as a military
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: organization under military rules and discipline--I as commander, with
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Bradley as my first lieutenant and Olson as my second, in command of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Englishmen; while von Schoenvorts was to act as an additional
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: second lieutenant and have charge of his own men.  The four of us were
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to constitute a military court under which men might be tried and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sentenced to punishment for infraction of military rules and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: discipline, even to the passing of the death-sentence.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I then had arms and ammunition issued to the Germans, and leaving
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Bradley and five men to guard the U-33, the balance of us went ashore.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The first thing we did was to taste the water of the little
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stream--which, to our delight, we found sweet, pure and cold.  This
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stream was entirely free from dangerous reptiles, because, as I later
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: discovered, they became immediately dormant when subjected to a much
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lower temperature than 70 degrees Fahrenheit.  They dislike cold water
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and keep as far away from it as possible.  There were countless
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brook-trout here, and deep holes that invited us to bathe, and along
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the bank of the stream were trees bearing a close resemblance to ash
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and beech and oak, their characteristics evidently induced by the lower
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: temperature of the air above the cold water and by the fact that their
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: roots were watered by the water from the stream rather than from the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: warm springs which we afterward found in such abundance elsewhere.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Our first concern was to fill the water tanks of the U-33 with fresh
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: water, and that having been accomplished, we set out to hunt for game
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and explore inland for a short distance.  Olson, von Schoenvorts, two
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Englishmen and two Germans accompanied me, leaving ten to guard the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ship and the girl.  I had intended leaving Nobs behind, but he got away
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and joined me and was so happy over it that I hadn't the heart to send
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him back.  We followed the stream upward through a beautiful country
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for about five miles, and then came upon its source in a little
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: boulder-strewn clearing. From among the rocks bubbled fully twenty
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ice-cold springs. North of the clearing rose sandstone cliffs to a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: height of some fifty to seventy-five feet, with tall trees growing at
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their base and almost concealing them from our view.  To the west the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: country was flat and sparsely wooded, and here it was that we saw our
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: first game--a large red deer.  It was grazing away from us and had not
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seen us when one of my men called my attention to it.  Motioning for
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: silence and having the rest of the party lie down, I crept toward the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quarry, accompanied only by Whitely.  We got within a hundred yards of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the deer when he suddenly raised his antlered head and pricked up his
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: great ears.  We both fired at once and had the satisfaction of seeing
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the buck drop; then we ran forward to finish him with our knives.  The
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deer lay in a small open space close to a clump of acacias, and we had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: advanced to within several yards of our kill when we both halted
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suddenly and simultaneously. Whitely looked at me, and I looked at
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Whitely, and then we both looked back in the direction of the deer.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Blime!" he said.  "Wot is hit, sir?"
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It looks to me, Whitely, like an error," I said; "some assistant god
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: who had been creating elephants must have been temporarily transferred
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to the lizard-department."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Hi wouldn't s'y that, sir," said Whitely; "it sounds blasphemous."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "It is no more blasphemous than that thing which is swiping our meat," I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: replied, for whatever the thing was, it had leaped upon our deer and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was devouring it in great mouthfuls which it swallowed without
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mastication.  The creature appeared to be a great lizard at least ten
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feet high, with a huge, powerful tail as long as its torso, mighty hind
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: legs and short forelegs.  When it had advanced from the wood, it hopped
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: much after the fashion of a kangaroo, using its hind feet and tail to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: propel it, and when it stood erect, it sat upon its tail.  Its head was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: long and thick, with a blunt muzzle, and the opening of the jaws ran
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: back to a point behind the eyes, and the jaws were armed with long
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sharp teeth. The scaly body was covered with black and yellow spots
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about a foot in diameter and irregular in contour.  These spots were
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: outlined in red with edgings about an inch wide.  The underside of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chest, body and tail were a greenish white.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Wot s'y we pot the bloomin' bird, sir?" suggested Whitely.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I told him to wait until I gave the word; then we would fire
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: simultaneously, he at the heart and I at the spine.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Hat the 'eart, sir--yes, sir," he replied, and raised his piece to his
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shoulder.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Our shots rang out together.  The thing raised its head and looked
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about until its eyes rested upon us; then it gave vent to a most
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: appalling hiss that rose to the crescendo of a terrific shriek and came
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for us.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Beat it, Whitely!" I cried as I turned to run.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We were about a quarter of a mile from the rest of our party, and in
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: full sight of them as they lay in the tall grass watching us. That they
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: saw all that had happened was evidenced by the fact that they now rose
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and ran toward us, and at their head leaped Nobs. The creature in our
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rear was gaining on us rapidly when Nobs flew past me like a meteor and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rushed straight for the frightful reptile. I tried to recall him, but
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he would pay no attention to me, and as I couldn't see him sacrificed,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I, too, stopped and faced the monster. The creature appeared to be more
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: impressed with Nobs than by us and our firearms, for it stopped as the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and dodged his opponent's thrust with ease.  Then he raced to the rear

text: of the tremendous thing and seized it by the tail. There Nobs made the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: error of his life.  Within that mottled organ were the muscles of a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Titan, the force of a dozen mighty catapults, and the owner of the tail

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was fully aware of the possibilities which it contained.  With a single
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: flip of the tip it sent poor Nobs sailing through the air a hundred
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feet above the ground, straight back into the clump of acacias from
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which the beast had leaped upon our kill--and then the grotesque thing
