title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Olson and von Schoenvorts came up a minute later with their men; then
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we all cautiously approached the still form upon the ground. The
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: creature was quite dead, and an examination resulted in disclosing the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fact that Whitely's bullet had pierced its heart, and mine had severed
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the spinal cord.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But why didn't it die instantly?" I exclaimed.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Because," said von Schoenvorts in his disagreeable way, "the beast is
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: so large, and its nervous organization of so low a caliber, that it
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: took all this time for the intelligence of death to reach and be
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: impressed upon the minute brain.  The thing was dead when your bullets
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: struck it; but it did not know it for several seconds--possibly a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: minute.  If I am not mistaken, it is an Allosaurus of the Upper
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Jurassic, remains of which have been found in Central Wyoming, in the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suburbs of New York."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: An Irishman by the name of Brady grinned.  I afterward learned that he
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had served three years on the traffic-squad of the Chicago police force.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had been calling Nobs in the meantime and was about to set out in
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: search of him, fearing, to tell the truth, to do so lest I find him
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mangled and dead among the trees of the acacia grove, when he suddenly
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: emerged from among the boles, his ears flattened, his tail between his
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: legs and his body screwed into a suppliant S. He was unharmed except
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for minor bruises; but he was the most chastened dog I have ever seen.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We gathered up what was left of the red deer after skinning and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cleaning it, and set out upon our return journey toward the U-boat. On
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the way Olson, von Schoenvorts and I discussed the needs of our
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: immediate future, and we were unanimous in placing foremost the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: necessity of a permanent camp on shore.  The interior of a U-boat is
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about as impossible and uncomfortable an abiding-place as one can well
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: imagine, and in this warm climate, and in warm water, it was almost
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unendurable.  So we decided to construct a palisaded camp.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Chapter 6
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As we strolled slowly back toward the boat, planning and discussing
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this, we were suddenly startled by a loud and unmistakable detonation.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "A shell from the U-33!" exclaimed von Schoenvorts.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "What can be after signifyin'?" queried Olson.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "They are in trouble," I answered for all, "and it's up to us to get
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: back to them.  Drop that carcass," I directed the men carrying the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: meat, "and follow me!"  I set off at a rapid run in the direction of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the harbor.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We ran for the better part of a mile without hearing anything more from
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the direction of the harbor, and then I reduced the speed to a walk,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for the exercise was telling on us who had been cooped up for so long
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the confined interior of the U-33. Puffing and panting, we plodded
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: on until within about a mile of the harbor we came upon a sight that
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: brought us all up standing. We had been passing through a little
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heavier timber than was usual to this part of the country, when we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suddenly emerged into an open space in the center of which was such a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: band as might have caused the most courageous to pause.  It consisted
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of upward of five hundred individuals representing several species
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: closely allied to man.  There were anthropoid apes and gorillas--these
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had no difficulty in recognizing; but there were other forms which I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had never before seen, and I was hard put to it to say whether they
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were ape or man.  Some of them resembled the corpse we had found upon
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the narrow beach against Caprona's sea-wall, while others were of a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: still lower type, more nearly resembling the apes, and yet others were
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: uncannily manlike, standing there erect, being less hairy and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: possessing better shaped heads.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There was one among the lot, evidently the leader of them, who bore a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: close resemblance to the so-called Neanderthal man of La
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Chapelle-aux-Saints.  There was the same short, stocky trunk upon which
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rested an enormous head habitually bent forward into the same curvature
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as the back, the arms shorter than the legs, and the lower leg
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: considerably shorter than that of modern man, the knees bent forward
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and never straightened.  This creature and one or two others who
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: appeared to be of a lower order than he, yet higher than that of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: apes, carried heavy clubs; the others were armed only with giant
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: muscles and fighting fangs--nature's weapons. All were males, and all
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were entirely naked; nor was there upon even the highest among them a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sign of ornamentation.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At sight of us they turned with bared fangs and low growls to confront
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us.  I did not wish to fire among them unless it became absolutely
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: necessary, and so I started to lead my party around them; but the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: instant that the Neanderthal man guessed my intention, he evidently
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: attributed it to cowardice upon our part, and with a wild cry he leaped
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward us, waving his cudgel above his head.  The others followed him,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and in a minute we should have been overwhelmed.  I gave the order to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fire, and at the first volley six of them went down, including the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Neanderthal man. The others hesitated a moment and then broke for the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trees, some running nimbly among the branches, while others lost
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: themselves to us between the boles.  Both von Schoenvorts and I noticed
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that at least two of the higher, manlike types took to the trees quite
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as nimbly as the apes, while others that more nearly approached man in
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carriage and appearance sought safety upon the ground with the gorillas.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: An examination disclosed that five of our erstwhile opponents were dead
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and the sixth, the Neanderthal man, was but slightly wounded, a bullet
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: having glanced from his thick skull, stunning him. We decided to take
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: him with us to camp, and by means of belts we managed to secure his
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hands behind his back and place a leash around his neck before he
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: regained consciousness.  We then retraced our steps for our meat being
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: convinced by our own experience that those aboard the U-33 had been
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: able to frighten off this party with a single shell--but when we came
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to where we had left the deer it had disappeared.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: On the return journey Whitely and I preceded the rest of the party by
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about a hundred yards in the hope of getting another shot at something
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: edible, for we were all greatly disgusted and disappointed by the loss
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of our venison.  Whitely and I advanced very cautiously, and not having
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the whole party with us, we fared better than on the journey out,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bagging two large antelope not a half-mile from the harbor; so with our
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: game and our prisoner we made a cheerful return to the boat, where we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: found that all were safe.  On the shore a little north of where we lay
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there were the corpses of twenty of the wild creatures who had attacked
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Bradley and his party in our absence, and the rest of whom we had met
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and scattered a few minutes later.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We felt that we had taught these wild ape-men a lesson and that because
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of it we would be safer in the future--at least safer from them; but we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: decided not to abate our carefulness one whit, feeling that this new
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: world was filled with terrors still unknown to us; nor were we wrong.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The following morning we commenced work upon our camp, Bradley, Olson,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: von Schoenvorts, Miss La Rue, and I having sat up half the night
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: discussing the matter and drawing plans.  We set the men at work
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: felling trees, selecting for the purpose jarrah, a hard,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weather-resisting timber which grew in profusion near by.  Half the men
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: labored while the other half stood guard, alternating each hour with an
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hour off at noon.  Olson directed this work.  Bradley, von Schoenvorts
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and I, with Miss La Rue's help, staked out the various buildings and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the outer wall.  When the day was done, we had quite an array of logs
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: nicely notched and ready for our building operations on the morrow, and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we were all tired, for after the buildings had been staked out we all
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fell in and helped with the logging--all but von Schoenvorts.  He,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: being a Prussian and a gentleman, couldn't stoop to such menial labor
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in the presence of his men, and I didn't see fit to ask it of him, as
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the work was purely voluntary upon our part.  He spent the afternoon
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shaping a swagger-stick from the branch of jarrah and talking with Miss
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: La Rue, who had sufficiently unbent toward him to notice his existence.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We saw nothing of the wild men of the previous day, and only once were
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we menaced by any of the strange denizens of Caprona, when some
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: frightful nightmare of the sky swooped down upon us, only to be driven
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: off by a fusillade of bullets.  The thing appeared to be some variety
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of pterodactyl, and what with its enormous size and ferocious aspect
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was most awe-inspiring.  There was another incident, too, which to me
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at least was far more unpleasant than the sudden onslaught of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: prehistoric reptile.  Two of the men, both Germans, were stripping a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: felled tree of its branches. Von Schoenvorts had completed his
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: swagger-stick, and he and I were passing close to where the two worked.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: One of them threw to his rear a small branch that he had just chopped
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: off, and as misfortune would have it, it struck von Schoenvorts across
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the face.  It couldn't have hurt him, for it didn't leave a mark; but
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he flew into a terrific rage, shouting: "Attention!" in a loud voice.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The sailor immediately straightened up, faced his officer, clicked his
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heels together and saluted.  "Pig!" roared the Baron, and struck the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fellow across the face, breaking his nose.  I grabbed von Schoenvorts'
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arm and jerked him away before he could strike again, if such had been
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his intention, and then he raised his little stick to strike me; but
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before it descended the muzzle of my pistol was against his belly and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he must have seen in my eyes that nothing would suit me better than an
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: excuse to pull the trigger.  Like all his kind and all other bullies,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: von Schoenvorts was a coward at heart, and so he dropped his hand to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his side and started to turn away; but I pulled him back, and there
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: before his men I told him that such a thing must never again
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: occur--that no man was to be struck or otherwise punished other than in
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: due process of the laws that we had made and the court that we had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: established. All the time the sailor stood rigidly at attention, nor
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: could I tell from his expression whether he most resented the blow his
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: officer had struck him or my interference in the gospel of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Kaiser-breed.  Nor did he move until I said to him:  "Plesser, you may
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: return to your quarters and dress your wound."  Then he saluted and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: marched stiffly off toward the U-33.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Just before dusk we moved out into the bay a hundred yards from shore
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and dropped anchor, for I felt that we should be safer there than
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: elsewhere.  I also detailed men to stand watch during the night and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: appointed Olson officer of the watch for the entire night, telling him
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to bring his blankets on deck and get what rest he could.  At dinner we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tasted our first roast Caprona antelope, and we had a mess of greens
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that the cook had found growing along the stream.  All during the meal
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: von Schoenvorts was silent and surly.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: After dinner we all went on deck and watched the unfamiliar scenes of a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Capronian night--that is, all but von Schoenvorts. There was less to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: see than to hear.  From the great inland lake behind us came the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hissing and the screaming of countless saurians. Above us we heard the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: flap of giant wings, while from the shore rose the multitudinous voices
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of a tropical jungle--of a warm, damp atmosphere such as must have
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: enveloped the entire earth during the Paleozoic and Mesozoic eras.  But
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: here were intermingled the voices of later eras--the scream of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: panther, the roar of the lion, the baying of wolves and a thunderous
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: growling which we could attribute to nothing earthly but which one day
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we were to connect with the most fearsome of ancient creatures.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: One by one the others went to their rooms, until the girl and I were
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: left alone together, for I had permitted the watch to go below for a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: few minutes, knowing that I would be on deck. Miss La Rue was very
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: quiet, though she replied graciously enough to whatever I had to say
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that required reply.  I asked her if she did not feel well.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Yes," she said, "but I am depressed by the awfulness of it all. I feel
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of so little consequence--so small and helpless in the face of all
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: these myriad manifestations of life stripped to the bone of its
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: savagery and brutality.  I realize as never before how cheap and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: valueless a thing is life.  Life seems a joke, a cruel, grim joke.  You
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: are a laughable incident or a terrifying one as you happen to be less
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: powerful or more powerful than some other form of life which crosses
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: your path; but as a rule you are of no moment whatsoever to anything
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but yourself.  You are a comic little figure, hopping from the cradle
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to the grave.  Yes, that is our trouble--we take ourselves too
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seriously; but Caprona should be a sure cure for that."  She paused and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: laughed.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You have evolved a beautiful philosophy," I said.  "It fills such a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: longing in the human breast.  It is full, it is satisfying, it is
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ennobling.  What wondrous strides toward perfection the human race
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: might have made if the first man had evolved it and it had persisted
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: until now as the creed of humanity."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I don't like irony," she said; "it indicates a small soul."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "What other sort of soul, then, would you expect from `a comic little
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: figure hopping from the cradle to the grave'?" I inquired. "And what
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: difference does it make, anyway, what you like and what you don't like?
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: You are here for but an instant, and you mustn't take yourself too
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seriously."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She looked up at me with a smile.  "I imagine that I am frightened and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: blue," she said, "and I know that I am very, very homesick and lonely."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There was almost a sob in her voice as she concluded.  It was the first
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: time that she had spoken thus to me.  Involuntarily, I laid my hand
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon hers where it rested on the rail.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I know how difficult your position is," I said; "but don't feel that
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you are alone.  There is--is one here who--who would do anything in the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: world for you," I ended lamely.  She did not withdraw her hand, and she
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: looked up into my face with tears on her cheeks and I read in her eyes
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the thanks her lips could not voice. Then she looked away across the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: weird moonlit landscape and sighed. Evidently her new-found philosophy
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had tumbled about her ears, for she was seemingly taking herself
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: seriously.  I wanted to take her in my arms and tell her how I loved
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her, and had taken her hand from the rail and started to draw her
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward me when Olson came blundering up on deck with his bedding.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The following morning we started building operations in earnest, and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: things progressed finely.  The Neanderthal man was something of a care,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for we had to keep him in irons all the time, and he was mighty savage
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when approached; but after a time he became more docile, and then we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tried to discover if he had a language. Lys spent a great deal of time
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: talking to him and trying to draw him out; but for a long while she was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unsuccessful.  It took us three weeks to build all the houses, which we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: constructed close by a cold spring some two miles from the harbor.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We changed our plans a trifle when it came to building the palisade,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for we found a rotted cliff near by where we could get all the flat
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: building-stone we needed, and so we constructed a stone wall entirely
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: around the buildings.  It was in the form of a square, with bastions
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and towers at each corner which would permit an enfilading fire along
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: any side of the fort, and was about one hundred and thirty-five feet
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: square on the outside, with walls three feet thick at the bottom and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about a foot and a half wide at the top, and fifteen feet high.  It
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: took a long time to build that wall, and we all turned in and helped
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: except von Schoenvorts, who, by the way, had not spoken to me except in
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the line of official business since our encounter--a condition of armed
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: neutrality which suited me to a T.  We have just finished it, the last
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: touches being put on today.  I quit about a week ago and commenced
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: working on this chronicle for our strange adventures, which will
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: account for any minor errors in chronology which may have crept in;
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there was so much material that I may have made some mistakes, but I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: think they are but minor and few.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I see in reading over the last few pages that I neglected to state that
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Lys finally discovered that the Neanderthal man possessed a language.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She has learned to speak it, and so have I, to some extent.  It was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he--his name he says is Am, or Ahm--who told us that this country is
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: called Caspak.  When we asked him how far it extended, he waved both
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arms about his head in an all-including gesture which took in,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: apparently, the entire universe. He is more tractable now, and we are
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: going to release him, for he has assured us that he will not permit his
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fellows to harm us. He calls us Galus and says that in a short time he
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: will be a Galu. It is not quite clear to us what he means.  He says
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that there are many Galus north of us, and that as soon as he becomes
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one he will go and live with them.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ahm went out to hunt with us yesterday and was much impressed by the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ease with which our rifles brought down antelopes and deer. We have
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been living upon the fat of the land, Ahm having shown us the edible
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fruits, tubers and herbs, and twice a week we go out after fresh meat.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: A certain proportion of this we dry and store away, for we do not know
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: what may come.  Our drying process is really smoking.  We have also
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dried a large quantity of two varieties of cereal which grow wild a few
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: miles south of us. One of these is a giant Indian maize--a lofty
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: perennial often fifty and sixty feet in height, with ears the size of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a man's body and kernels as large as your fist.  We have had to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: construct a second store house for the great quantity of this that we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have gathered.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: September 3, 1916:  Three months ago today the torpedo from the U-33
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: started me from the peaceful deck of the American liner upon the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: strange voyage which has ended here in Caspak.  We have settled down to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: an acceptance of our fate, for all are convinced that none of us will
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ever see the outer world again.  Ahm's repeated assertions that there
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: are human beings like ourselves in Caspak have roused the men to a keen
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: desire for exploration.  I sent out one party last week under Bradley.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Ahm, who is now free to go and come as he wishes, accompanied them.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They marched about twenty-five miles due west, encountering many
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: terrible beasts and reptiles and not a few manlike creatures whom Ahm
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sent away.  Here is Bradley's report of the expedition:
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Marched fifteen miles the first day, camping on the bank of a large
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stream which runs southward.  Game was plentiful and we saw several
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: varieties which we had not before encountered in Caspak. Just before
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: making camp we were charged by an enormous woolly rhinoceros, which
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Plesser dropped with a perfect shot.  We had rhinoceros-steaks for
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: supper.  Ahm called the thing "Atis."  It was almost a continuous
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: battle from the time we left the fort until we arrived at camp.  The
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: mind of man can scarce conceive the plethora of carnivorous life in
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: this lost world; and their prey, of course, is even more abundant.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The second day we marched about ten miles to the foot of the cliffs.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Passed through dense forests close to the base of the cliffs. Saw
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: manlike creatures and a low order of ape in one band, and some of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: men swore that there was a white man among them. They were inclined to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: attack us at first; but a volley from our rifles caused them to change
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their minds.  We scaled the cliffs as far as we could; but near the top
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they are absolutely perpendicular without any sufficient cleft or
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: protuberance to give hand or foot-hold.  All were disappointed, for we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hungered for a view of the ocean and the outside world.  We even had a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hope that we might see and attract the attention of a passing ship. Our
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: exploration has determined one thing which will probably be of little
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: value to us and never heard of beyond Caprona's walls--this crater was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: once entirely filled with water. Indisputable evidence of this is on
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the face of the cliffs.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Our return journey occupied two days and was as filled with adventure
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as usual.  We are all becoming accustomed to adventure. It is beginning
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to pall on us.  We suffered no casualties and there was no illness.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had to smile as I read Bradley's report.  In those four days he had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: doubtless passed through more adventures than an African big-game
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hunter experiences in a lifetime, and yet he covered it all in a few
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lines.  Yes, we are becoming accustomed to adventure. Not a day passes
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that one or more of us does not face death at least once.  Ahm taught
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: us a few things that have proved profitable and saved us much
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ammunition, which it is useless to expend except for food or in the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: last recourse of self-preservation. Now when we are attacked by large
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: flying reptiles we run beneath spreading trees; when land carnivora
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: threaten us, we climb into trees, and we have learned not to fire at
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: any of the dinosaurs unless we can keep out of their reach for at least
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: two minutes after hitting them in the brain or spine, or five minutes
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: after puncturing their hearts--it takes them so long to die. To hit
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them elsewhere is worse than useless, for they do not seem to notice
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it, and we had discovered that such shots do not kill or even disable
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: September 7, 1916:  Much has happened since I last wrote.  Bradley is
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: away again on another exploration expedition to the cliffs.  He expects
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to be gone several weeks and to follow along their base in search of a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: point where they may be scaled.  He took Sinclair, Brady, James, and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Tippet with him.  Ahm has disappeared.  He has been gone about three
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: days; but the most startling thing I have on record is that von
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Schoenvorts and Olson while out hunting the other day discovered oil
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: about fifteen miles north of us beyond the sandstone cliffs. Olson says
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there is a geyser of oil there, and von Schoenvorts is making
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: preparations to refine it.  If he succeeds, we shall have the means for
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: leaving Caspak and returning to our own world. I can scarce believe the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: truth of it.  We are all elated to the seventh heaven of bliss.  Pray
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: God we shall not be disappointed.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I have tried on several occasions to broach the subject of my love to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Lys; but she will not listen.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Chapter 7
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: October 8, 1916:  This is the last entry I shall make upon my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: manuscript.  When this is done, I shall be through.  Though I may pray
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that it reaches the haunts of civilized man, my better judgment tells
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me that it will never be perused by other eyes than mine, and that even
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: though it should, it would be too late to avail me.  I am alone upon
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the summit of the great cliff overlooking the broad Pacific.  A chill
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: south wind bites at my marrow, while far below me I can see the tropic
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: foliage of Caspak on the one hand and huge icebergs from the near
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Antarctic upon the other.  Presently I shall stuff my folded manuscript
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into the thermos bottle I have carried with me for the purpose since I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: left the fort--Fort Dinosaur we named it--and hurl it far outward over
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the cliff-top into the Pacific.  What current washes the shore of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caprona I know not; whither my bottle will be borne I cannot even
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: guess; but I have done all that mortal man may do to notify the world
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of my whereabouts and the dangers that threaten those of us who remain
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: alive in Caspak--if there be any other than myself.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: About the 8th of September I accompanied Olson and von Schoenvorts to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the oil-geyser.  Lys came with us, and we took a number of things which
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: von Schoenvorts wanted for the purpose of erecting a crude refinery.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: We went up the coast some ten or twelve miles in the U-33, tying up to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shore near the mouth of a small stream which emptied great volumes of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crude oil into the sea--I find it difficult to call this great lake by
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: any other name. Then we disembarked and went inland about five miles,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: where we came upon a small lake entirely filled with oil, from the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: center of which a geyser of oil spouted.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: On the edge of the lake we helped von Schoenvorts build his primitive
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: refinery.  We worked with him for two days until he got things fairly
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: well started, and then we returned to Fort Dinosaur, as I feared that
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Bradley might return and be worried by our absence. The U-33 merely
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: landed those of us that were to return to the fort and then retraced
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: its course toward the oil-well.  Olson, Whitely, Wilson, Miss La Rue,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and myself disembarked, while von Schoenvorts and his German crew
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: returned to refine the oil.  The next day Plesser and two other Germans
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: came down overland for ammunition. Plesser said they had been attacked
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: by wild men and had exhausted a great deal of ammunition.  He also
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: asked permission to get some dried meat and maize, saying that they
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were so busy with the work of refining that they had no time to hunt.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I let him have everything he asked for, and never once did a suspicion
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of their intentions enter my mind.  They returned to the oil-well the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: same day, while we continued with the multitudinous duties of camp life.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For three days nothing of moment occurred.  Bradley did not return; nor
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: did we have any word from von Schoenvorts.  In the evening Lys and I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: went up into one of the bastion towers and listened to the grim and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: terrible nightlife of the frightful ages of the past.  Once a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: saber-tooth screamed almost beneath us, and the girl shrank close
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: against me.  As I felt her body against mine, all the pent love of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: these three long months shattered the bonds of timidity and conviction,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and I swept her up into my arms and covered her face and lips with
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: kisses.  She did not struggle to free herself; but instead her dear
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arms crept up about my neck and drew my own face even closer to hers.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You love me, Lys?" I cried.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I felt her head nod an affirmative against my breast.  "Tell me, Lys,"
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I begged, "tell me in words how much you love me."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Low and sweet and tender came the answer:  "I love you beyond all
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conception."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: My heart filled with rapture then, and it fills now as it has each of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the countless times I have recalled those dear words, as it shall fill
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: always until death has claimed me.  I may never see her again; she may
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not know how I love her--she may question, she may doubt; but always
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: true and steady, and warm with the fires of love my heart beats for the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: girl who said that night:  "I love you beyond all conception."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For a long time we sat there upon the little bench constructed for the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sentry that we had not as yet thought it necessary to post in more than
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one of the four towers.  We learned to know one another better in those
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: two brief hours than we had in all the months that had intervened since
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we had been thrown together.  She told me that she had loved me from
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the first, and that she never had loved von Schoenvorts, their
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: engagement having been arranged by her aunt for social reasons.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: That was the happiest evening of my life; nor ever do I expect to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: experience its like; but at last, as is the way of happiness, it
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: terminated.  We descended to the compound, and I walked with Lys to the
title: The Land That Time Forgot

text: door of her quarters.  There again she kissed me and bade me good

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I went to my own room, and there I sat by the light of one of the crude

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the camp. These brutes are enormous and exceedingly ferocious.  I

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: might a sweet smile upon an enraged tusker. Afterward I shot the beast,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and Nobs had a feast while I dressed, for he had become quite a

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: so about nine o'clock, becoming apprehensive lest she might be

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: previous night upon retiring; but Lys was gone.  To say that I was

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of a shriek.  We all looked up as the noise approached apparently just

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: phenomenon.

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: over two miles, but we did not pause until the harbor was in view, and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the outline of the U-33, black smoke vomiting from her funnel.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Von Schoenvorts had succeeded in refining the oil!  The cur had broken
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Schoenvorts.

text: Olson, Whitely, Wilson, and I stood for a moment looking at one
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: another.  It seemed incredible that man could be so perfidious--that we

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we would not have been surprised at anything from him; but the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As soon as I had assured myself that such was the case, I made my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

text: Chapter 8
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was a sad leave-taking as in silence I shook hands with each of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: three remaining men.  Even poor Nobs appeared dejected as we quit the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: compound and set out upon the well-marked spoor of the abductor.  Not
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: once did I turn my eyes backward toward Fort Dinosaur.  I have not
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: looked upon it since--nor in all likelihood shall I ever look upon it
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: again.  The trail led northwest until it reached the western end of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sandstone cliffs to the north of the fort; there it ran into a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: well-defined path which wound northward into a country we had not as
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: yet explored. It was a beautiful, gently rolling country, broken by
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: occasional outcroppings of sandstone and by patches of dense forest
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: relieved by open, park-like stretches and broad meadows whereon grazed
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: countless herbivorous animals--red deer, aurochs, and infinite variety
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of antelope and at least three distinct species of horse, the latter
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ranging in size from a creature about as large as Nobs to a magnificent
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: animal fourteen to sixteen hands high. These creatures fed together in
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: perfect amity; nor did they show any great indications of terror when
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Nobs and I approached. They moved out of our way and kept their eyes
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon us until we had passed; then they resumed their feeding.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The path led straight across the clearing into another forest, lying
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon the verge of which I saw a bit of white.  It appeared to stand out
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in marked contrast and incongruity to all its surroundings, and when I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stopped to examine it, I found that it was a small strip of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: muslin--part of the hem of a garment. At once I was all excitement, for
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I knew that it was a sign left by Lys that she had been carried this
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: way; it was a tiny bit torn from the hem of the undergarment that she
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wore in lieu of the night-robes she had lost with the sinking of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: liner. Crushing the bit of fabric to my lips, I pressed on even more
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rapidly than before, because I now knew that I was upon the right trail
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and that up to this point at least, Lys still had lived.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I made over twenty miles that day, for I was now hardened to fatigue
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and accustomed to long hikes, having spent considerable time hunting
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and exploring in the immediate vicinity of camp. A dozen times that day
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was my life threatened by fearsome creatures of the earth or sky,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: though I could not but note that the farther north I traveled, the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fewer were the great dinosaurs, though they still persisted in lesser
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: numbers.  On the other hand the quantity of ruminants and the variety
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and frequency of carnivorous animals increased.  Each square mile of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspak harbored its terrors.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At intervals along the way I found bits of muslin, and often they
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: reassured me when otherwise I should have been doubtful of the trail to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: take where two crossed or where there were forks, as occurred at
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: several points.  And so, as night was drawing on, I came to the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: southern end of a line of cliffs loftier than any I had seen before,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and as I approached them, there was wafted to my nostrils the pungent
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: aroma of woodsmoke.  What could it mean? There could, to my mind, be
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but a single solution: man abided close by, a higher order of man than
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we had as yet seen, other than Ahm, the Neanderthal man. I wondered
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: again as I had so many times that day if it had not been Ahm who stole
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Lys.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Cautiously I approached the flank of the cliffs, where they terminated
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in an abrupt escarpment as though some all powerful hand had broken off
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a great section of rock and set it upon the surface of the earth.  It
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was now quite dark, and as I crept around the edge of the cliff, I saw
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: at a little distance a great fire around which were many
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: figures--apparently human figures. Cautioning Nobs to silence, and he
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had learned many lessons in the value of obedience since we had entered
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspak, I slunk forward, taking advantage of whatever cover I could
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: find, until from behind a bush I could distinctly see the creatures
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: assembled by the fire.  They were human and yet not human.  I should
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: man and what is known as the Grimaldi race.  Their features were
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: portion of both torso and limbs were covered with short hair, and their
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: physical proportions were in many aspects apelike, though not so much
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: so as were Ahm's.  They carried themselves in a more erect position,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: although their arms were considerably longer than those of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Neanderthal man.  As I watched them, I saw that they possessed a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: language, that they had knowledge of fire and that they carried besides
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the wooden club of Ahm, a thing which resembled a crude stone hatchet.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Evidently they were very low in the scale of humanity, but they were a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: step upward from those I had previously seen in Caspak.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: But what interested me most was the slender figure of a dainty girl,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: clad only in a thin bit of muslin which scarce covered her knees--a bit
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of muslin torn and ragged about the lower hem.  It was Lys, and she was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: alive and so far as I could see, unharmed.  A huge brute with thick
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lips and prognathous jaw stood at her shoulder. He was talking loudly
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and gesticulating wildly.  I was close enough to hear his words, which
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: were similar to the language of Ahm, though much fuller, for there were

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was saying--which in effect was that he had found and captured this
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Galu, that she was his and that he defied anyone to question his right
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of possession. It appeared to me, as I afterward learned was the fact,

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: assembled members of the tribe looked on and listened in a sort of dull
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and perfunctory apathy, for the speaker was by far the mightiest of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: clan.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There seemed no one to dispute his claims when he said, or rather
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shouted, in stentorian tones:  "I am Tsa.  This is my she. Who wishes
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her more than Tsa?"
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I do," I said in the language of Ahm, and I stepped out into the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: firelight before them.  Lys gave a little cry of joy and started toward
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me, but Tsa grasped her arm and dragged her back.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Who are you?" shrieked Tsa.  "I kill!  I kill!  I kill!"
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "The she is mine," I replied, "and I have come to claim her. I kill if
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you do not let her come to me."  And I raised my pistol to a level with
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his heart.  Of course the creature had no conception of the purpose of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the strange little implement which I was poking toward him.  With a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to the ground, the others of his tribe, overcome by fright at the

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: outstretched arms, ran toward me.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: As I crushed her to me, there rose from the black night behind us and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice
