text: developed in the directing of it--that and my horsemanship I always
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have been proud of.  And now, that day, all the long hours that I had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: put into careful study, practice and training brought me in two or
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: three minutes a full return upon my investment.  Californians, as a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rule, are familiar with ju-jutsu, and I especially had made a study of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: it for several years, both at school and in the gym of the Los Angeles
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Athletic Club, while recently I had had, in my employ, a Jap who was a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wonder at the art.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It took me just about thirty seconds to break the elbow of one of my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: assailants, trip another and send him stumbling backward among his
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fellows, and throw the third completely over my head in such a way that
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when he fell his neck was broken.  In the instant that the others of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the party stood in mute and inactive surprise, I unslung my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rifle--which, carelessly, I had been carrying across my back; and when
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they charged, as I felt they would, I put a bullet in the forehead of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: one of them.  This stopped them all temporarily--not the death of their
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fellow, but the report of the rifle, the first they had ever heard.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Before they were ready to attack me again, one of them spoke in a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: commanding tone to his fellows, and in a language similar but still
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more comprehensive than that of the tribe to the south, as theirs was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more complete than Ahm's.  He commanded them to stand back and then he
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: advanced and addressed me.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He asked me who I was, from whence I came and what my intentions were.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I replied that I was a stranger in Caspak, that I was lost and that my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: only desire was to find my way back to my companions.  He asked where
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: they were and I told him toward the south somewhere, using the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspakian phrase which, literally translated, means "toward the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beginning."  His surprise showed upon his face before he voiced it in
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: words.  "There are no Galus there," he said.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I tell you," I said angrily, "that I am from another country, far from
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspak, far beyond the high cliffs.  I do not know who the Galus may
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: be; I have never seen them.  This is the farthest north I have been.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Look at me--look at my clothing and my weapons. Have you ever seen a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Galu or any other creature in Caspak who possessed such things?"
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He had to admit that he had not, and also that he was much interested
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in me, my rifle and the way I had handled his three warriors.  Finally
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he became half convinced that I was telling him the truth and offered
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to aid me if I would show him how I had thrown the man over my head and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: also make him a present of the "bang-spear," as he called it.  I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: refused to give him my rifle, but promised to show him the trick he
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wished to learn if he would guide me in the right direction.  He told
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me that he would do so tomorrow, that it was too late today and that I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: might come to their village and spend the night with them.  I was loath
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to lose so much time; but the fellow was obdurate, and so I accompanied
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: them.  The two dead men they left where they had fallen, nor gave them
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a second glance--thus cheap is life upon Caspak.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: These people also were cave-dwellers, but their caves showed the result
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of a higher intelligence that brought them a step nearer to civilized
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: man than the tribe next "toward the beginning." The interiors of their
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: caverns were cleared of rubbish, though still far from clean, and they
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had pallets of dried grasses covered with the skins of leopard, lynx,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and bear, while before the entrances were barriers of stone and small,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rudely circular stone ovens.  The walls of the cavern to which I was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: conducted were covered with drawings scratched upon the sandstone.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: There were the outlines of the giant red-deer, of mammoths, of tigers
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and other beasts.  Here, as in the last tribe, there were no children
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: or any old people.  The men of this tribe had two names, or rather
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: names of two syllables, and their language contained words of two
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: syllables; whereas in the tribe of Tsa the words were all of a single
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: syllable, with the exception of a very few like Atis and Galus.  The
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: chief's name was To-jo, and his household consisted of seven females
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and himself.  These women were much more comely, or rather less hideous
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: than those of Tsa's people; one of them, even, was almost pretty, being
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: less hairy and having a rather nice skin, with high coloring.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: They were all much interested in me and examined my clothing and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: equipment carefully, handling and feeling and smelling of each article.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I learned from them that their people were known as Band-lu, or
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: spear-men; Tsa's race was called Sto-lu--hatchet-men.  Below these in
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the scale of evolution came the Bo-lu, or club-men, and then the Alus,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: who had no weapons and no language.  In that word I recognized what to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me seemed the most remarkable discovery I had made upon Caprona, for
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unless it were mere coincidence, I had come upon a word that had been
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: handed down from the beginning of spoken language upon earth, been
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: handed down for millions of years, perhaps, with little change.  It was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the sole remaining thread of the ancient woof of a dawning culture
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: which had been woven when Caprona was a fiery mount upon a great
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: land-mass teeming with life.  It linked the unfathomable then to the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eternal now.  And yet it may have been pure coincidence; my better
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: judgment tells me that it is coincidence that in Caspak the term for
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: speechless man is Alus, and in the outer world of our own day it is
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Alalus.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: The comely woman of whom I spoke was called So-ta, and she took such a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lively interest in me that To-jo finally objected to her attentions,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: emphasizing his displeasure by knocking her down and kicking her into a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: corner of the cavern.  I leaped between them while he was still kicking
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: her, and obtaining a quick hold upon him, dragged him screaming with
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pain from the cave.  Then I made him promise not to hurt the she again,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon pain of worse punishment. So-ta gave me a grateful look; but To-jo
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and the balance of his women were sullen and ominous.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Later in the evening So-ta confided to me that she was soon to leave
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the tribe.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "So-ta soon to be Kro-lu," she confided in a low whisper.  I asked her
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: what a Kro-lu might be, and she tried to explain, but I do not yet know
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: if I understood her.  From her gestures I deduced that the Kro-lus were
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a people who were armed with bows and arrows, had vessels in which to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cook their food and huts of some sort in which they lived, and were
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: accompanied by animals.  It was all very fragmentary and vague, but the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: idea seemed to be that the Kro-lus were a more advanced people than the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Band-lus.  I pondered a long time upon all that I had heard, before
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sleep came to me.  I tried to find some connection between these
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: various races that would explain the universal hope which each of them
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: harbored that some day they would become Galus.  So-ta had given me a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: suggestion; but the resulting idea was so weird that I could scarce
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: even entertain it; yet it coincided with Ahm's expressed hope, with the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: various steps in evolution I had noted in the several tribes I had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: encountered and with the range of type represented in each tribe.  For
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: example, among the Band-lu were such types as So-ta, who seemed to me
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to be the highest in the scale of evolution, and To-jo, who was just a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shade nearer the ape, while there were others who had flatter noses,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: more prognathous faces and hairier bodies.  The question puzzled me.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Possibly in the outer world the answer to it is locked in the bosom of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Sphinx.  Who knows?  I do not.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Thinking the thoughts of a lunatic or a dope-fiend, I fell asleep; and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when I awoke, my hands and feet were securely tied and my weapons had
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: been taken from me.  How they did it without awakening me I cannot tell
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you.  It was humiliating, but it was true. To-jo stood above me.  The
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: early light of morning was dimly filtering into the cave.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Tell me," he demanded, "how to throw a man over my head and break his
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: neck, for I am going to kill you, and I wish to know this thing before
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you die."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Of all the ingenuous declarations I have ever heard, this one copped
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the proverbial bun.  It struck me as so funny that, even in the face of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: death, I laughed.  Death, I may remark here, had, however, lost much of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his terror for me.  I had become a disciple of Lys' fleeting philosophy
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the valuelessness of human life. I realized that she was quite
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: right--that we were but comic figures hopping from the cradle to the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: grave, of interest to practically no other created thing than ourselves
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and our few intimates.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Behind To-jo stood So-ta.  She raised one hand with the palm toward
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me--the Caspakian equivalent of a negative shake of the head.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Let me think about it," I parried, and To-jo said that he would wait
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: until night.  He would give me a day to think it over; then he left,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and the women left--the men for the hunt, and the women, as I later
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: learned from So-ta, for the warm pool where they immersed their bodies
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as did the shes of the Sto-lu.  "Ata," explained So-ta, when I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: questioned her as to the purpose of this matutinal rite; but that was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: later.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I must have lain there bound and uncomfortable for two or three hours
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when at last So-ta entered the cave.  She carried a sharp knife--mine,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in fact, and with it she cut my bonds.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Come!" she said.  "So-ta will go with you back to the Galus. It is
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: time that So-ta left the Band-lu.  Together we will go to the Kro-lu,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and after that the Galus.  To-jo will kill you tonight. He will kill
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: So-ta if he knows that So-ta aided you.  We will go together."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "I will go with you to the Kro-lu," I replied, "but then I must return
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to my own people `toward the beginning.'"
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "You cannot go back," she said.  "It is forbidden.  They would kill
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: you.  Thus far have you come--there is no returning."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "But I must return," I insisted.  "My people are there.  I must return
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and lead them in this direction."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She insisted, and I insisted; but at last we compromised.  I was to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: escort her as far as the country of the Kro-lu and then I was to go
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: back after my own people and lead them north into a land where the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dangers were fewer and the people less murderous. She brought me all my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: belongings that had been filched from me--rifle, ammunition, knife, and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: thermos bottle, and then hand in hand we descended the cliff and set
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: off toward the north.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: For three days we continued upon our way, until we arrived outside a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: village of thatched huts just at dusk.  So-ta said that she would enter
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: alone; I must not be seen if I did not intend to remain, as it was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: forbidden that one should return and live after having advanced this
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: far.  So she left me. She was a dear girl and a stanch and true
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: comrade--more like a man than a woman.  In her simple barbaric way she
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was both refined and chaste.  She had been the wife of To-jo.  Among
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Kro-lu she would find another mate after the manner of the strange
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Caspakian world; but she told me very frankly that whenever I returned,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she would leave her mate and come to me, as she preferred me above all
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: others.  I was becoming a ladies' man after a lifetime of bashfulness!
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At the outskirts of the village I left her without even seeing the sort
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of people who inhabited it, and set off through the growing darkness
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward the south.  On the third day I made a detour westward to avoid
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the country of the Band-lu, as I did not care to be detained by a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: meeting with To-jo.  On the sixth day I came to the cliffs of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Sto-lu, and my heart beat fast as I approached them, for here was Lys.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Soon I would hold her tight in my arms again; soon her warm lips would
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: merge with mine. I felt sure that she was still safe among the hatchet
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: people, and I was already picturing the joy and the love-light in her
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: eyes when she should see me once more as I emerged from the last clump
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of trees and almost ran toward the cliffs.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was late in the morning.  The women must have returned from the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pool; yet as I drew near, I saw no sign of life whatever. "They have
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: remained longer," I thought; but when I was quite close to the base of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the cliffs, I saw that which dashed my hopes and my happiness to earth.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Strewn along the ground were a score of mute and horrible suggestions
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of what had taken place during my absence--bones picked clean of flesh,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the bones of manlike creatures, the bones of many of the tribe of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Sto-lu; nor in any cave was there sign of life.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Closely I examined the ghastly remains fearful each instant that I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: should find the dainty skull that would shatter my happiness for life;
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: but though I searched diligently, picking up every one of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: twenty-odd skulls, I found none that was the skull of a creature but
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: slightly removed from the ape.  Hope, then, still lived.  For another
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: three days I searched north and south, east and west for the hatchetmen
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of Caspak; but never a trace of them did I find.  It was raining most
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of the time now, and the weather was as near cold as it ever seems to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: get on Caprona.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At last I gave up the search and set off toward Fort Dinosaur. For a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: week--a week filled with the terrors and dangers of a primeval world--I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pushed on in the direction I thought was south. The sun never shone;
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the rain scarcely ever ceased falling. The beasts I met with were fewer
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in number but infinitely more terrible in temper; yet I lived on until
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there came to me the realization that I was hopelessly lost, that a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: year of sunshine would not again give me my bearings; and while I was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cast down by this terrifying knowledge, the knowledge that I never
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: again could find Lys, I stumbled upon another grave--the grave of

title: The Land That Time Forgot

text: September--killed by a saber-tooth tiger.

text: I think that I almost gave up then.  Never in my life have I felt more
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hopeless or helpless or alone.  I was lost.  I could not find my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: friends.  I did not even know that they still lived; in fact, I could
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: not bring myself to believe that they did.  I was sure that Lys was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dead.  I wanted myself to die, and yet I clung to life--useless and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hopeless and harrowing a thing as it had become. I clung to life
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: because some ancient, reptilian forbear had clung to life and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: transmitted to me through the ages the most powerful motive that guided
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: his minute brain--the motive of self-preservation.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: At last I came to the great barrier-cliffs; and after three days of mad
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: effort--of maniacal effort--I scaled them.  I built crude ladders; I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wedged sticks in narrow fissures; I chopped toe-holds and finger-holds
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: with my long knife; but at last I scaled them. Near the summit I came
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon a huge cavern.  It is the abode of some mighty winged creature of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the Triassic--or rather it was. Now it is mine.  I slew the thing and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: took its abode.  I reached the summit and looked out upon the broad
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: gray terrible Pacific of the far-southern winter.  It was cold up
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: there.  It is cold here today; yet here I sit watching, watching,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: watching for the thing I know will never come--for a sail.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Chapter 10
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Once a day I descend to the base of the cliff and hunt, and fill my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stomach with water from a clear cold spring.  I have three gourds which
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I fill with water and take back to my cave against the long nights.  I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have fashioned a spear and a bow and arrow, that I may conserve my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ammunition, which is running low.  My clothes are worn to shreds.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Tomorrow I shall discard them for leopard-skins which I have tanned and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: sewn into a garment strong and warm.  It is cold up here.  I have a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: fire burning and I sit bent over it while I write; but I am safe here.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: No other living creature ventures to the chill summit of the barrier
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cliffs.  I am safe, and I am alone with my sorrows and my remembered
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: joys--but without hope. It is said that hope springs eternal in the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: human breast; but there is none in mine.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I am about done.  Presently I shall fold these pages and push them into
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: my thermos bottle.  I shall cork it and screw the cap tight, and then I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: shall hurl it as far out into the sea as my strength will permit.  The
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wind is off-shore; the tide is running out; perhaps it will be carried
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: into one of those numerous ocean-currents which sweep perpetually from
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: pole to pole and from continent to continent, to be deposited at last
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: upon some inhabited shore.  If fate is kind and this does happen, then,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for God's sake, come and get me!
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was a week ago that I wrote the preceding paragraph, which I thought
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would end the written record of my life upon Caprona. I had paused to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: put a new point on my quill and stir the crude ink (which I made by
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: crushing a black variety of berry and mixing it with water) before
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: attaching my signature, when faintly from the valley far below came an
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unmistakable sound which brought me to my feet, trembling with
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: excitement, to peer eagerly downward from my dizzy ledge.  How full of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: meaning that sound was to me you may guess when I tell you that it was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the report of a firearm!  For a moment my gaze traversed the landscape
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beneath until it was caught and held by four figures near the base of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the cliff--a human figure held at bay by three hyaenodons, those
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ferocious and blood-thirsty wild dogs of the Eocene.  A fourth beast
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lay dead or dying near by.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I couldn't be sure, looking down from above as I was; but yet I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: trembled like a leaf in the intuitive belief that it was Lys, and my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: judgment served to confirm my wild desire, for whoever it was carried
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: only a pistol, and thus had Lys been armed.  The first wave of sudden
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: joy which surged through me was short-lived in the face of the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: swift-following conviction that the one who fought below was already
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: doomed.  Luck and only luck it must have been which had permitted that
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: first shot to lay low one of the savage creatures, for even such a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: heavy weapon as my pistol is entirely inadequate against even the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: lesser carnivora of Caspak. In a moment the three would charge! A
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: futile shot would but tend more greatly to enrage the one it chanced to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: hit; and then the three would drag down the little human figure and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: tear it to pieces.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: And maybe it was Lys!  My heart stood still at the thought, but mind
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and muscle responded to the quick decision I was forced to make. There
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was but a single hope--a single chance--and I took it. I raised my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rifle to my shoulder and took careful aim.  It was a long shot, a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: dangerous shot, for unless one is accustomed to it, shooting from a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: considerable altitude is most deceptive work. There is, though,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: something about marksmanship which is quite beyond all scientific laws.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Upon no other theory can I explain my marksmanship of that moment.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Three times my rifle spoke--three quick, short syllables of death. I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: did not take conscious aim; and yet at each report a beast crumpled in
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: its tracks!
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: From my ledge to the base of the cliff is a matter of several thousand
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: feet of dangerous climbing; yet I venture to say that the first ape
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: from whose loins my line has descended never could have equaled the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: speed with which I literally dropped down the face of that rugged
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: escarpment.  The last two hundred feet is over a steep incline of loose
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rubble to the valley bottom, and I had just reached the top of this
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: when there arose to my ears an agonized cry--"Bowen!  Bowen!  Quick, my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: love, quick!"
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had been too much occupied with the dangers of the descent to glance
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: down toward the valley; but that cry which told me that it was indeed
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Lys, and that she was again in danger, brought my eyes quickly upon her
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: in time to see a hairy, burly brute seize her and start off at a run
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: toward the near-by wood.  From rock to rock, chamoislike, I leaped
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: downward toward the valley, in pursuit of Lys and her hideous abductor.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: He was heavier than I by many pounds, and so weighted by the burden he
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: carried that I easily overtook him; and at last he turned, snarling, to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: face me.  It was Kho of the tribe of Tsa, the hatchet-men.  He
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: recognized me, and with a low growl he threw Lys aside and came for me.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "The she is mine," he cried. "I kill!  I kill!"
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I had had to discard my rifle before I commenced the rapid descent of
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the cliff, so that now I was armed only with a hunting knife, and this
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I whipped from its scabbard as Kho leaped toward me. He was a mighty
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beast, mightily muscled, and the urge that has made males fight since
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the dawn of life on earth filled him with the blood-lust and the thirst
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to slay; but not one whit less did it fill me with the same primal
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: passions.  Two abysmal beasts sprang at each other's throats that day
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beneath the shadow of earth's oldest cliffs--the man of now and the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: man-thing of the earliest, forgotten then, imbued by the same deathless
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: passion that has come down unchanged through all the epochs, periods
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and eras of time from the beginning, and which shall continue to the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: incalculable end--woman, the imperishable Alpha and Omega of life.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Kho closed and sought my jugular with his teeth.  He seemed to forget
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the hatchet dangling by its aurochs-hide thong at his hip, as I forgot,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for the moment, the dagger in my hand.  And I doubt not but that Kho
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: would easily have bested me in an encounter of that sort had not Lys'
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: voice awakened within my momentarily reverted brain the skill and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cunning of reasoning man.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Bowen!" she cried.  "Your knife!  Your knife!"
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: It was enough.  It recalled me from the forgotten eon to which my brain
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had flown and left me once again a modern man battling with a clumsy,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: unskilled brute.  No longer did my jaws snap at the hairy throat before
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: me; but instead my knife sought and found a space between two ribs over
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the savage heart.  Kho voiced a single horrid scream, stiffened
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: spasmodically and sank to the earth. And Lys threw herself into my
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: arms.  All the fears and sorrows of the past were wiped away, and once
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: again I was the happiest of men.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: With some misgivings I shortly afterward cast my eyes upward toward the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: precarious ledge which ran before my cave, for it seemed to me quite
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: beyond all reason to expect a dainty modern belle to essay the perils
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: of that frightful climb.  I asked her if she thought she could brave
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the ascent, and she laughed gayly in my face.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "Watch!" she cried, and ran eagerly toward the base of the cliff. Like
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: a squirrel she clambered swiftly aloft, so that I was forced to exert
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: myself to keep pace with her.  At first she frightened me; but
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: presently I was aware that she was quite as safe here as was I. When we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: finally came to my ledge and I again held her in my arms, she recalled
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: to my mind that for several weeks she had been living the life of a
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: cave-girl with the tribe of hatchet-men.  They had been driven from
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: their former caves by another tribe which had slain many and carried
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: off quite half the females, and the new cliffs to which they had flown
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: had proven far higher and more precipitous, so that she had become,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: through necessity, a most practiced climber.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: She told me of Kho's desire for her, since all his females had been
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: stolen and of how her life had been a constant nightmare of terror as
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: she sought by night and by day to elude the great brute. For a time
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: Nobs had been all the protection she required; but one day he
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: disappeared--nor has she seen him since.  She believes that he was
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: deliberately made away with; and so do I, for we both are sure that he
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: never would have deserted her.  With her means of protection gone, Lys
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: was now at the mercy of the hatchet-man; nor was it many hours before
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: he had caught her at the base of the cliff and seized her; but as he
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: bore her triumphantly aloft toward his cave, she had managed to break
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: loose and escape him.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: "For three days he has pursued me," she said, "through this horrible
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: world.  How I have passed through in safety I cannot guess, nor how I
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: have always managed to outdistance him; yet I have done it, until just
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: as you discovered me.  Fate was kind to us, Bowen."
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: I nodded my head in assent and crushed her to me. And then we talked
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and planned as I cooked antelope-steaks over my fire, and we came to
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: the conclusion that there was no hope of rescue, that she and I were
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: doomed to live and die upon Caprona.  Well, it might be worse!  I would
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: rather live here always with Lys than to live elsewhere without her;
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: and she, dear girl, says the same of me; but I am afraid of this life
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: for her.  It is a hard, fierce, dangerous life, and I shall pray always
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: that we shall be rescued from it--for her sake.
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: That night the clouds broke, and the moon shone down upon our little
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: ledge; and there, hand in hand, we turned our faces toward heaven and
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: plighted our troth beneath the eyes of God.  No human agency could have
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: married us more sacredly than we are wed.  We are man and wife, and we
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: are content.  If God wills it, we shall live out our lives here.  If He
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: wills otherwise, then this manuscript which I shall now consign to the
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: inscrutable forces of the sea shall fall into friendly hands.  However,
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: we are each without hope. And so we say good-bye in this, our last
title: The Land That Time Forgot
author: Burroughs, Edgar Rice

text: message to the world beyond the barrier cliffs.
